summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the death of Jeffrey Epstein by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center. The statement reaffirms the office's commitment to its ongoing investigation into sex trafficking of minors and encourages victims to come forward.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found unresponsive in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center and pronounced dead shortly thereafter from an apparent suicide.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein died by apparent suicide in his cell at the Manhattan Correctional Center on the morning of August 10, 2019.
Epstein was facing federal charges brought by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York for engaging in the sex trafficking of minors, which included a conspiracy count.
The U.S. Attorney's Office stated its investigation into the conduct charged in the indictment remains ongoing despite Epstein's death.
The statement directly addresses Epstein's victims, urging others to come forward and contact the FBI.
The document frames Epstein's death as a potential hurdle to providing victims their day in court.
